title: jskm
code: install.packages("devtools") library(devtools) install_github("jinseob2kim/jskm") library(jskm)

title: jskm
code: # Load dataset library(survival) data(colon) #> Warning in data(colon): data set 'colon' not found fit <- survfit(Surv(time, status) ~ rx, data = colon)  # Plot the data jskm(fit) jskm(fit,   table = T, pval = T, label.nrisk = "No. at risk", size.label.nrisk = 8,   xlabs = "Time(Day)", ylabs = "Survival", ystratalabs = c("Obs", "Lev", "Lev + 5FU"), ystrataname = "rx",   marks = F, timeby = 365, xlims = c(0, 3000), ylims = c(0.25, 1), showpercent = T ) #> Warning: Removed 16 rows containing missing values or values outside the scale range #> (`geom_step()`). #> Warning: Removed 3 rows containing missing values or values outside the scale range #> (`geom_text()`).

title: jskm
code: jskm(fit, ci = T, cumhaz = T, mark = F, ylab = "Cumulative incidence (%)", surv.scale = "percent", pval = T, pval.size = 6, pval.coord = c(300, 0.7))

title: jskm
code: jskm(fit, mark = F, surv.scale = "percent", pval = T, table = T, cut.landmark = 500, showpercent = T)

title: jskm
text: status2 variable: 0 - censoring, 1 - event, 2 - competing risk
code: ## Make competing risk variable, Not real colon$status2 <- colon$status colon$status2[1:400] <- 2 colon$status2 <- factor(colon$status2) fit2 <- survfit(Surv(time, status2) ~ rx, data = colon) jskm(fit2, mark = F, surv.scale = "percent", table = T, status.cmprsk = "1", data = colon) jskm(fit2, mark = F, surv.scale = "percent", table = T, status.cmprsk = "1", showpercent = T, cut.landmark = 500)

title: jskm
code: jskm(fit, theme = "jama", cumhaz = T, table = T, mark = F, ylab = "Cumulative incidence (%)", surv.scale = "percent", pval = T, pval.size = 6, pval.coord = c(300, 0.7))

title: jskm
code: jskm(fit, theme = "nejm", nejm.infigure.ratiow = 0.6, nejm.infigure.ratioh = 0.4, nejm.infigure.ylim = c(0, 0.7), cumhaz = T, table = T, mark = F, ylab = "Cumulative incidence (%)", surv.scale = "percent", pval = T, pval.size = 6, pval.coord = c(300, 0.7)) #> Scale for y is already present. #> Adding another scale for y, which will replace the existing scale.

what: Weighted Kaplan-Meier plot - svykm.object in survey package
title: jskm
text: want get confidence interval, apply se = T option svykm object.
code: library(survey) #> Loading required package: grid #> Loading required package: Matrix #>  #> Attaching package: 'survey' #> The following object is masked from 'package:graphics': #>  #>     dotchart data(pbc, package = "survival") pbc$randomized <- with(pbc, !is.na(trt) & trt > 0) biasmodel <- glm(randomized ~ age * edema, data = pbc) pbc$randprob <- fitted(biasmodel)  dpbc <- svydesign(id = ~1, prob = ~randprob, strata = ~edema, data = subset(pbc, randomized))  s1 <- svykm(Surv(time, status > 0) ~ 1, design = dpbc) s2 <- svykm(Surv(time, status > 0) ~ sex, design = dpbc)  svyjskm(s1) svyjskm(s2) svyjskm(s2, cumhaz = T, ylab = "Cumulative incidence(%)", surv.scale = "percent", showpercent = T) s3 <- svykm(Surv(time, status > 0) ~ sex, design = dpbc, se = T) svyjskm(s3) svyjskm(s3, ci = F, showpercent = T) svyjskm(s3, ci = F, surv.scale = "percent", pval = T, table = T, cut.landmark = 1000)

title: jskm
code: svyjskm(s2, theme = "jama", pval = T, table = T, design = dpbc)

title: jskm
code: svyjskm(s2, theme = "nejm", nejm.infigure.ratiow = 0.4, nejm.infigure.ratioh = 0.4, nejm.infigure.ylim = c(0.2, 1), pval = T, table = T, design = dpbc)

title: Kaplan-Meier Plot with ggplot2
text: Kaplan-Meier Plot ‘ggplot2’: ‘survfit’ ‘svykm’ objects ‘survival’ ‘survey’ packages.

title: Kaplan-Meier Plot with ggplot2
code: install.packages("jskm")  ## From github: latest version install.packages("remotes") remotes::install_github("jinseob2kim/jskm")  library(jskm)

title: Kaplan-Meier Plot with ggplot2
code: # Load dataset library(survival) data(colon) fit <- survfit(Surv(time, status) ~ rx, data = colon)  # Plot the data jskm(fit) jskm(fit,   table = T, pval = T, med = T, label.nrisk = "No. at risk", size.label.nrisk = 8,   xlabs = "Time(Day)", ylabs = "Survival", ystratalabs = c("Obs", "Lev", "Lev + 5FU"), ystrataname = "rx",   marks = F, timeby = 365, xlims = c(0, 3000), ylims = c(0.25, 1), showpercent = T )

title: Kaplan-Meier Plot with ggplot2
code: jskm(fit, ci = T, cumhaz = T, mark = F, ylab = "Cumulative incidence (%)", surv.scale = "percent", pval = T, pval.size = 6, pval.coord = c(300, 0.7))

title: Kaplan-Meier Plot with ggplot2
code: jskm(fit, mark = F, surv.scale = "percent", pval = T, table = T, cut.landmark = 500) jskm(fit, mark = F, surv.scale = "percent", pval = T, table = T, cut.landmark = 500, showpercent = T)

title: Kaplan-Meier Plot with ggplot2
text: status2 variable: 0 - censoring, 1 - event, 2 - competing risk
code: ## Make competing risk variable, Not real colon$status2 <- colon$status colon$status2[1:400] <- 2 colon$status2 <- factor(colon$status2) fit2 <- survfit(Surv(time, status2) ~ rx, data = colon) jskm(fit2, mark = F, surv.scale = "percent", table = T, status.cmprsk = "1") jskm(fit2, mark = F, surv.scale = "percent", table = T, status.cmprsk = "1", showpercent = T, cut.landmark = 500)

title: Kaplan-Meier Plot with ggplot2
code: jskm(fit, theme = "jama", cumhaz = T, table = T, mark = F, ylab = "Cumulative incidence (%)", surv.scale = "percent", pval = T, pval.size = 6, pval.coord = c(300, 0.7))

title: Kaplan-Meier Plot with ggplot2
code: jskm(fit, theme = "nejm", nejm.infigure.ratiow = 0.7, nejm.infigure.ratioh = 0.4, nejm.infigure.ylim = c(0, 0.7), cumhaz = T, table = T, mark = F, ylab = "Cumulative incidence (%)", surv.scale = "percent", pval = T, pval.size = 6, pval.coord = c(300, 0.7))

what: Weighted Kaplan-Meier plot - svykm.object in survey package
title: Kaplan-Meier Plot with ggplot2
text: want get confidence interval, apply se = T option svykm object.
code: library(survey) data(pbc, package = "survival") pbc$randomized <- with(pbc, !is.na(trt) & trt > 0) biasmodel <- glm(randomized ~ age * edema, data = pbc) pbc$randprob <- fitted(biasmodel)  dpbc <- svydesign(id = ~1, prob = ~randprob, strata = ~edema, data = subset(pbc, randomized))  s1 <- svykm(Surv(time, status > 0) ~ 1, design = dpbc) s2 <- svykm(Surv(time, status > 0) ~ sex, design = dpbc)  svyjskm(s1) svyjskm(s2, pval = T, table = T, design = dpbc) svyjskm(s2, cumhaz = T, ylab = "Cumulative incidence (%)", surv.scale = "percent", pval = T, design = dpbc, pval.coord = c(300, 0.7), showpercent = T) s3 <- svykm(Surv(time, status > 0) ~ sex, design = dpbc, se = T) svyjskm(s3) svyjskm(s3, ci = F) svyjskm(s3, ci = F, surv.scale = "percent", pval = T, table = T, cut.landmark = 1000, showpercent = T)

title: Kaplan-Meier Plot with ggplot2
code: svyjskm(s2, theme = "jama", pval = T, table = T, design = dpbc)

title: Kaplan-Meier Plot with ggplot2
code: svyjskm(s2, theme = "nejm", nejm.infigure.ratiow = 0.45, nejm.infigure.ratioh = 0.4, nejm.infigure.ylim = c(0.2, 1), pval = T, table = T, design = dpbc)

title: Adjusted Log-Rank Test — adjusted.LR
text: Performs adjusted log-rank test considering weights.

title: Adjusted Log-Rank Test — adjusted.LR
code: adjusted.LR(times, failures, variable, weights = NULL)

title: Adjusted Log-Rank Test — adjusted.LR
text: times numeric vector survival times. failures binary vector indicating event occurrence. variable numeric binary variable (0 1) indicating group membership. weights numeric vector weights.

title: Adjusted Log-Rank Test — adjusted.LR
text: list containing test statistic p-value.

what: Creates a Kaplan-Meier plot for survfit object. — jskm
title: Creates a Kaplan-Meier plot for survfit object. — jskm
text: Creates Kaplan-Meier plot risk tables survfit object.

title: Creates a Kaplan-Meier plot for survfit object. — jskm
code: jskm(   sfit,   table = FALSE,   table.censor = FALSE,   xlabs = "Time-to-event",   ylabs = NULL,   xlims = c(0, max(sfit$time)),   ylims = c(0, 1),   surv.scale = c("default", "percent"),   ystratalabs = NULL,   ystrataname = "Strata",   timeby = signif(max(sfit$time)/7, 1),   main = "",   pval = FALSE,   pval.size = 5,   pval.coord = c(NULL, NULL),   pval.testname = T,   marks = TRUE,   shape = 3,   med = FALSE,   legend = TRUE,   legendposition = c(0.85, 0.8),   ci = FALSE,   subs = NULL,   label.nrisk = "Numbers at risk",   size.label.nrisk = 10,   linecols = "Set1",   dashed = FALSE,   cumhaz = F,   cluster.option = "None",   cluster.var = NULL,   data = NULL,   cut.landmark = NULL,   showpercent = F,   status.cmprsk = NULL,   linewidth = 0.75,   theme = NULL,   nejm.infigure.ratiow = 0.6,   nejm.infigure.ratioh = 0.5,   nejm.infigure.ylim = c(0, 1),   surv.by = NULL,   nejm.surv.by = NULL,   hr = FALSE,   hr.size = 5,   hr.coord = c(NULL, NULL),   hr.testname = F,   ... )

title: Creates a Kaplan-Meier plot for survfit object. — jskm
text: sfit survfit object table logical: Create table graphic K-M plot, indicating -risk numbers? table.censor logical: Add numbers censored table graphic xlabs x-axis label ylabs y-axis label xlims numeric: list min max x-axis. Default = c(0,max(sfit$time)) ylims numeric: list min max y-axis. Default = c(0,1) surv.scale scale transformation survival curves. Allowed values "default" "percent". ystratalabs character list. list names strata. Default = names(sfit$strata) ystrataname legend name. Default = "Strata" timeby numeric: control granularity along time-axis; defaults 7 time-points. Default = signif(max(sfit$time)/7, 1) main plot title pval logical: add pvalue plot? pval.size numeric value specifying p-value text size. Default 5. pval.coord numeric vector, length 2, specifying x y coordinates p-value. Default values NULL pval.testname logical: add '(Log-rank)' text p-value. Default = F marks logical: censoring marks added? shape shape censoring marks , default vertical line med median line added plot? Default = F legend logical. legend added plot? legendposition numeric. x, y position legend plotted. Default=c(0.85,0.8) ci logical. confidence intervals plotted. Default = FALSE subs = NULL, label.nrisk Numbers risk label. Default = "Numbers risk" size.label.nrisk Font size label.nrisk. Default = 10 linecols Character Character vector. Colour brewer pallettes colour lines. Default ="Set1", "black" black dashed line, character vector customization line colors. dashed logical. variety linetypes used identify lines. Default = FALSE cumhaz Show cumulative incidence function, Default: F cluster.option Cluster option p value, Option: "None", "cluster", "frailty", Default: "None" cluster.var Cluster variable data select specific data - reactive input, Default = NULL cut.landmark cut-landmark analysis, Default = NULL showpercent Shows percentages right side. status.cmprsk Status value competing risk analysis, Default = 2nd level status variable linewidth Line witdh, Default = 0.75 theme Theme plot, Default = NULL, "nejm" NEJMOA style, "jama" JAMA style nejm.infigure.ratiow Ratio infigure width total width, Default = 0.6 nejm.infigure.ratioh Ratio infigure height total height, Default = 0.5 nejm.infigure.ylim y-axis limit infigure, Default = c(0,1) surv.breaks unit y-axis, default = NULL(ggplot default) nejm.surv.breaks unit y-axis nejm figure, default = NULL(ggplot default) hr logical: add hazard ratio plot? hr.size numeric value specifying HR text size. Default 5. hr.coord numeric vector, length 2, specifying x y coordinates p-value. Default values NULL hr.testname logical: add '(Log-rank)' text p-value. Default = F ... PARAM_DESCRIPTION

code: svyjskm(   sfit,   theme = NULL,   xlabs = "Time-to-event",   ylabs = "Survival probability",   xlims = NULL,   ylims = c(0, 1),   ystratalabs = NULL,   ystrataname = NULL,   surv.scale = c("default", "percent"),   timeby = NULL,   main = "",   pval = FALSE,   pval.size = 4,   pval.coord = c(NULL, NULL),   pval.testname = F,   marks = FALSE,   hr = FALSE,   hr.size = 2,   hr.coord = c(NULL, NULL),   med = FALSE,   legend = TRUE,   legendposition = c(0.85, 0.8),   ci = NULL,   linecols = "Set1",   dashed = FALSE,   cumhaz = F,   design = NULL,   subs = NULL,   table = F,   table.censor = F,   label.nrisk = "Numbers at risk",   size.label.nrisk = 10,   cut.landmark = NULL,   showpercent = F,   linewidth = 0.75,   nejm.infigure.ratiow = 0.6,   nejm.infigure.ratioh = 0.5,   nejm.infigure.ylim = c(0, 1),   surv.by = NULL,   nejm.surv.by = NULL,   ... )

title: Creates a Weighted Kaplan-Meier plot - svykm.object in survey package — svyjskm
text: sfit svykm object theme Theme plot, Default = NULL, "nejm" NEJMOA style, "jama" JAMA style xlabs x-axis label, Default: 'Time--event' ylabs y-axis label. xlims numeric: list min max x-axis. Default: NULL ylims numeric: list min max y-axis. Default: c(0, 1) ystratalabs character list. list names strata. Default: NULL ystrataname legend name. Default: 'Strata' surv.scale scale transformation survival curves. Allowed values "default" "percent". timeby numeric: control granularity along time-axis; defaults 7 time-points. main plot title, Default: ” pval logical: add pvalue plot?, Default: FALSE pval.size numeric value specifying p-value text size. Default 4. pval.coord numeric vector, length 2, specifying x y coordinates p-value. Default values NULL pval.testname logical: add '(Log-rank)' text p-value. Default = F marks logical: censoring marks added? hr logical: add Hazard Ratio plot?, Default: FALSE hr.size numeric value specifying Hazard Ratio text size. Default 2. hr.coord numeric vector, length 2, specifying x y coordinates Hazard Ratio. Default values NULL med median line added plot? Default = F legend logical. legend added plot? legendposition numeric. x, y position legend plotted. Default=c(0.85,0.8) ci logical. confidence intervals plotted. Default = NULL linecols Character Character vector. Colour brewer pallettes colour lines. Default ="Set1", "black" black dashed line, character vector customization line colors. dashed logical. variety linetypes used identify lines. Default: FALSE cumhaz Show cumulaive incidence function, Default: F design Data design reactive design data , Default: NULL subs = NULL, table logical: Create table graphic K-M plot, indicating -risk numbers? table.censor logical: Add numbers censored table graphic label.nrisk Numbers risk label. Default = "Numbers risk" size.label.nrisk Font size label.nrisk. Default = 10 cut.landmark cut-landmark analysis, Default = NULL showpercent Shows percentages right side. linewidth Line witdh, Default = 0.75 nejm.infigure.ratiow Ratio infigure width total width, Default = 0.6 nejm.infigure.ratioh Ratio infigure height total height, Default = 0.5 nejm.infigure.ylim y-axis limit infigure, Default = c(0,1) surv.breaks unit y-axis, default = NULL(ggplot default) nejm.surv.breaks unit y-axis nejm figure, default = NULL(ggplot default) ... PARAM_DESCRIPTION

title: Creates a Weighted Kaplan-Meier plot - svykm.object in survey package — svyjskm
code: library(survey) #> Loading required package: grid #> Loading required package: Matrix #>  #> Attaching package: ‘survey’ #> The following object is masked from ‘package:graphics’: #>  #>     dotchart data(pbc, package = "survival") pbc$randomized <- with(pbc, !is.na(trt) & trt > 0) biasmodel <- glm(randomized ~ age * edema, data = pbc) pbc$randprob <- fitted(biasmodel) dpbc <- svydesign(id = ~1, prob = ~randprob, strata = ~edema, data = subset(pbc, randomized)) s1 <- svykm(Surv(time, status > 0) ~ sex, design = dpbc) svyjskm(s1)
